children.value: You need to set the parent container to
. When the position is relative, everything that will be under the container with the position to
will be absolute to the relative parent.

.parent { position: relative; }

.child { position: absolute; bottom: 0; right:0; }
From here, if you create a child inside the parent container, the child will be at the bottom of the parent.

Last line at the bottom
An absolute div (or any other element) relative to the first
parent. In the case that no element has been marked something else than the
(like to relative) than the first element will be used which is the Html element.
